title: Keep BSD sockets alive for a music apps with backgroundMediaPlayback capability
body: Music app can provide to its users an extended network functionality such as audio streaming, UPnP/DLNA or SMB/CIFS or FTP client to get music files from server, UPnP/DLNA client to send audio data to renderer, UPnP/DLNA media server or renderer. Such functionality is common to music apps in Google Play Store, Apple Store, BlackBerry World.

comments.body: Thanks for the feedback, Dmitry. I'll make sure the right folks take a look to see how this can be improved.

> Aaron Oneal
> the media stack is not doing it on your behalf like Media Foundation, MediaPlayer, etc.
That is true because with WASAPI you're building the media source and managing the socket yourself, the media stack is not doing it on your behalf like Media Foundation, MediaPlayer, etc.

> Aaron Oneal
> As long as playback is occurring and content is being streamed by the media stack the network will remain active.
As long as playback is occurring and content is being streamed by the media stack the network will remain active.
